inn1.comm: good start from Malinga, slightly back of a length, around off, slight shape away. Watson defends it to cover
away movement from back of a length, Watson tries the late-cut, and is beaten

Malinga tries the magic outswinger, getting it to start from leg, and looking to beat the outside edge. Even though Watson plays across its line, he gets enough bat on it to get a couple in the midwicket region
starts closer to off this time, and Watson defends with a straight bat
clipped away off the pads, not much swing this time
Haddin gets off the mark with a single pushed to wide of mid-on
short ball, not too wide, Haddin goes for a full-blooded cut, and is beaten - not enough room there
slight swing inwards - he bowls big inswingers in Sri Lanka - Haddin lets it go through to the keeper
this one holds its line outside off, Haddin shoulders arms
nicely driven, crisp shot. He chases this one, is playing away from the body, but meets it perfectly with an open face, and times it perfectly, and places it between cover and extra cover
this one comes in a bit, Haddin plays it towards midwicket
merely pushed with an open face, finds the gap between cover-point and cover, gets an easy couple
this one gets a bit big at Watson - 144.1ks, kicks from just short of a length, and Watson, shaping up to dab it down to third man, is surprised and is hit in the top glove
stifled shout for lbw, but it starts too straight and doesn't swing much
comes onto the front foot to push this length ball to cover
plays on the up, straight to cover
more bounce - 142.7ks - and it's hardly dug in short, beats Watson on the cut, Sanga collects it chest high
gets a thick inside edge for a single to fine leg
there's Kula's big inswinger, swinging late and big, Watson is surprised but it is swinging down the leg side
beautiful off-drive, Haddin makes them look really nice, high elbow, not much follow through, all along the ground, beating mid-off. And it was hardly driving length
stays back and pushes this wide of mid-off for a single
this one holds its line and takes a thick outer edge towards third man
inswinger, hit back to Kula on the bounce
shorter, wider, Haddin mistimes an attempt to force in through the off side
well bowled, short, good bounce, aimed around the chest area, no room at all
slightly slower, legcutter I suppose, Watson covers the movement and keeps it down
flashes at this shortish delivery away from his body, gets a thick edge that bounces twice before reaching third man
back of a length, just outside off, Haddin defends it to cover
another nice short one - he is cuffing them up - with the bouncers aimed at the chest/throat area, and with zero room
there is some room available on this bouncer, but Haddin doesn't want a piece of it. Sways out of the line
stays back to defend an inswinger pitched in the good-length area
another big inswinger, Watson clips it off the pads - there is no deep fine leg and they come back for three
that was agricultural, no feet, slogging across the line, getting an inside edge that evades the stumps and the keeper
another big inswinger, hits him on the pad, but it is clearly headed down the leg side
that's a good comeback from Haddin. He lofts this one over mid-on - hits down the line as opposed to across, and times it well
Kula shortens the length now, and Haddin stays back to block it
Watson presses forward to push a lenght ball to cover

Malinga you beauty! Lovely slower ball. He has been troubling them with pace and bounce, and this is the first slower ball he has bowled. This pitches on a length, around leg stump, and Watson is way too early into the shot. The ball holds its line, and takes the leading edge that settles with midwicket. Sri Lankans are thrilled
short ball, outside off, Haddin shoulders arms
pitches short of a length and leaves Haddin, who defends it to cover
the fuller one, nearly a yorker, Haddin keeps it out
another slower ball, but it is too full, and it is easier for Haddin to check the shot and keep the ball down into the leg side
not the best of starts, half tracker, down the leg side, with fine leg up. Haddin gets an underside edge past short fine leg
fuller, outside off, Haddin pushes it square, but not in a gap
runs a shortish delivery down to third man for a single
Clarke leaves this outside off
angling into the pads, Clarke plays it with soft hands, towards fine leg, and comes back for an easy two
shoulders arms to one outside off
back of a length, around off, Haddin defends solidly
opens the face on a similar delivery, but can't beat point
slower ball, inches short of being a yorker, Haddin keeps it out and steals a single - this has gone straight to mid-on, albeit very slowly, and that is what allowed them time to complete the single
short outside off, left alone
short again, Clarke plays the pull, keeps it down, gets a single to fine leg
gets behind a shortish delivery and defends it into the off side
another sharp single, tip and run really, towards point
nicely played late-cut, not too short, but there is width, and Haddin stays back and tries to use Kula's pace, placing it between point and short third man
slightly fuller, slightly closer to off, defended to cover
similar delivery, played similarly towards cover-point
played slightly in front of his body, gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket
pushes at it away from the body, gets a fine outside edge, but unfine enough to go wide of the keeper
steers a shortish delivery down to third man
driven to mid-off, and they decide against the single
slight extra bounce around off, Clarke keeps it down and gets a single to midwicket
beautiful shot! Haddin makes room, takes half a step down the track, doesn't care this is nowhere near driving length, and times it beautifully with an open face - between mid-off and extra cover
slower ball, Haddin is awake to it, defends off the back foot
another lovely shot, this time to the left of cover, delays the shot a bit and forces it between cover and cover-point. He is timing them really well today
hit back to the bowler, Murali dives to his right to field
dip there, Clarke defends in front of his body
bowling from wide of the crease, is Murali, and Clarke leaves the crease and dabs the offbreak into the leg side for one
the first time Haddin has looked in trouble today. Murali pushes in the toppie, Haddin stays back and plays for spin, has his outside edge missed
regulation offbreak, and he punches it through the covers
Haddin happy to be playing him off the back foot, defends this offbreak
driven on the up, but Randiv makes a nice diving save at extra cover
comes forward and pushes this length ball to mid-on
away swinger, and wide, Clarke squeezes it past point
clipped off the pads, but can't beat midwicket
nicely flicked away past midwicket, from around off-stump line
back of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
comes down the track again, gets close to it, and then pushes it down the ground for one
Haddin is not picking Murali here. Another straighter one has him poking and missing
offbreak, and he is happy to defend
comes forward to Murali for the first time, defends the doosra well
forward again, pushes this down to long-on
comes down the track, still not quite to the pitch of the ball, pushes it to the straightish midwicket
the rare ugly shot from Haddin, swiping away into the leg side, getting an inside edge for one
holds its line outside off, Clarke stays on the crease and defends
walks right across the stumps and comes down the pitch too, misses it, and strangely Kula hardly goes up in appeal. They take a leg-bye
goes for the cut, but it is too full for the shot, and he is duly beaten
slower ball, worked wide of midwicket for one
Clarke sends Haddin back: he had hit this full ball straight to midwicket
worked around the corner for one
nicely played, presses forward, sees a shortish ball, rocks back, and then cuts it in front of square - punch really. Clarke's first boundary, and Australia's first in 26 balls
comes down the track again, but ends up pushing it back to Murali
cat and mouse - Murali goes for the good old stumping down the leg side, but Clarke - despite having charged him - is balanced and glances it fine - that's two boundaries in quick time
shortish outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
turning into the pads, defended towards midwicket
starts off with a gentle short ball, Clarke pulls towards deep midwicket, and a fumble from Silva lets them complete the couple easily
dismisses this away, and turns his back to it! Lovely straight hit, uppish, but between the bowler and mid-on
goes outside off, Clarke pushes it towards cover
slower ball outside off, Clarke looks to run it down but can't get it past point

top catch! Nice delivery too, moving away from back of a length, Clarke goes for an ill-advised cut, and gets a thick edge that is dying on Sangakkara, who dives in front and to his right, holds it one-handed, then gets the left hand over to control the ball even as he is tumbling over
angling across the left-hander who leaves it be
turns in sharply, Haddin gets a thickish edge towards short fine leg

Dropped? Missed stumping? Surely one of the two. Like Pied Piper he draws Hussey out of the crease. He drives at it with hard hands. There seems to be an edge but Sanga can't hold onto it, and Jayawardene misses the ricochet too. Anyhow he was outside the crease too
defended into the off side
leaves this alone outside off
comes forward, pushes it to cover
sharp offbreak outside off, leaves it alone
punched off the back foot, through the covers, for one
seaming into his pads, Hussey works it away for one
stays back to defend this to cover
legcutter, turned to midwicket from outside off

The pressure works! Murali's introduction has tied Australia down, and Perera has produced wicket-taking deliveries in back-to-back overs. This was short and wide all right, but got a bit big on Haddin, who had committed to the cut shot, and he failed to keep it down. Dilshan dives to his left at backward point to complete a regulation catch by his standards

what a beaut! Ripper. Perera and Sri Lanka are on fire at the MCG. Another legcutter. He is on a hat-trick! Perfect delivery first up. Back of a length, pitching middle and off, cutting away, beating the poke, hitting the top of off
offbreak outside off, left alone
pushed straight to cover
fuller, closer to him, so he pushes it through covers
Marsh presses forward to defend it
well bowled, the offbreak angling in, then leaving him, and beating his outside edge

Murali can't believe it! He thinks this is plumb, and it is pretty close to being a straightforward leg-before. And he has bowled it cleverly. The doosra. Marsh plays for the offbreak, is nowhere near it, is hit right in front of the stumps. The big stride seems to have saved him
on target, cutting in towards Hussey, who tucks it away off the hips
full, overpitched actually, hit straight to mid-on
runs this down to third man for one
looks to open the face on this one, gets it past point for one
length ball, drives it on the up, hit straight to mid-on
worked away off the pads, towards fine leg, and they take on Tharanga's arm, and come back for two
nicely pushed against the turn, into the vacant on side
Murali wants them to against the turn, and Marsh does it, pushing it to mid-on, and charges for one
shorter, goes deep into the crease, and dabs it against the turn, into the open spaces on the on side
Marsh looks to do the same, but can't get it past Murali
the doosra now, and he works it towards short fine
short and wide, and Hussey misses out, cutting it straight to short cover
angling into the pads, no turn, kisses the pad
again no turn, and he works it around the corner for one
goes deep into the crease, forces this into the on side
flights this one nicely, pitches middle and off, ad holds its line. Marsh defends
nudges this into the on side for a single
nicely worked away towards fine leg for a single
flighted delivery, overpitched, but driven straight to extra cover
stretches forward, plays with an open face, gets a single wide of point
good running, swept away to deep backward square, and they take the second on the throw - and it's a wide throw too. Sanga is not pleased
pushed wide of mid-on for a single
flat offbreak outside off, opens the face towards point
flighted ball outside off, pushed to short cover
guides an offbreak past point for a single
tips and runs, towards point
defended back to the bowler
offreak, pitching leg and middle, and turning away slightly, defended

another big shout for lbw, Marsh beaten on the sweep, and they all go up right away. They seem convinced, Paul Reiffel doesn't. Did he get himself outside the line of off? Yes he did. Good call from Paul
defended to cover
short and wide for a loosener, cut away to sweeper-cover
gentle flighted delivery, pushed to long-off for one
looks to paddle, takes his eyes off it, and is beaten
pushed to sweeper-cover for one
opens the face, takes a single to short third man
full delivery, driven to sweeper-cover for one
blocks out an offbreak
full and flat, driven square for a single
shimmies down the track, is cramped up for room, and gets it as far as midwicket
angled into the pads, and worked away to fine leg
shortish, and they run a single after having hit straight to mid-on
slower through the air, Marsh checks his shot, defends it back to the bowler
overpitched, pushed to long-on for one
edged, thick edge. It is just the in-between length that has him confused. Marsh looks to cut but it is not that short, and the edge is too thick for the keeper to take
comes down the track and hits this to long-on for one
goes deep into the crease, works it towards midwicket for one
plays for the turn, the ball goes with the arm, thuds into the pad, headed to miss the leg stump
slightly short, he is quick to rock back and cut
full ball, hit straight to mid-on
clipped off the pads for another single
back of a length, pushed to wide of mid-on for a single
angling across Hussey, who presses forward and defends
pushes a length ball down to long-off for yet another single
tries the bouncer, Hussey pulls it in front of square, along the ground
full and flat, driven past extra cover
full and wide, driven through covers again
pushed down to long-off for another single
shortish, cut away behind square
cut away, Mathews fumbles at cover-point, but they don't risk the run off the misfield
faster one, played straight to mid-on
starts off with a slower ball outside off, left alone
angling too far across him - only the second extra of the innings
gets it right this time, back of a length, starting around off, and then cutting away, Marsh pokes at it and is beaten
slower ball, nicely guided between cover-point and point
looks to dab it in the point region, but Jayawardene's dive there keeps him in the crease
short, and nicely pulled away, keeping it down, square of fine leg, gets a couple
goes chasing a wide delivery, beaten by inches - called a wide
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
swept from well outside off, powerfully, in the gap between fine leg and deep square. Malinga's dive denies them the boundary
swept in front of square, gets a single
driven with an open face, can't beat the diving Silva at straightish extra cover
angled into the pads, worked away for a single
tossed-up delivery, defended to cover
looks to force this through the off side, but it is too close to him. Ends up dabbing it into the ground, and then on towards slip
length ball, around off, pushed to long-off for a single
goes for the yorker, ends up bowling a low full toss, which is hit straight to the straight extra cover
left alone outside off
another low full toss, clipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length, pushed wide of cover for another single

nearly caught-and-bowled. well not quite. It was hit back at him hard, and he had no time to recover. Good timing too, beats mid-on, but not quite long-off, who comes across and takes Australia's boundary drought to 16.4 overs
full, too full, placed wide of long-on for two
looks to cut, can't get it past point
pulled away, there is nobody inside the circle on the on side, and hence he can take the risk of pulling one that is not too short. Placed well too. Vast open spaces on the on side
on the pads again, worked away for another single
looks for the late-cut, is beaten, and then lifts his head to see there is a slip too. Not the cleverest of shots
pays the regulation cut and gets a single to sweeper-cover
there is an appeal for a leg-before as he misses out on the sweep, but it is angling down the leg side
short, stays low, hit straight to midwicket
arm ball, nearly squeezes through his defence, the bat comes down just in time to get a thick inside edge. Arms go up in the air only to realise there is wood involved
pushed to cover
cut away to sweeper-cover for a single
worked around the corner for another single
overpitched, driven to long-off for one

again Sri Lanka break through just when Australia look to get on to a threatening partnership. Extra bounce for Randiv there. The ball is there to be cut, at least it seems so until it kicks and bounces, and takes a thick edge that Sanga hangs on to really well
defends a flat offbreak back to Randiv. Slightly opened up, expecting an offbreak
another forward defensive
too straight, worked away around the corner
nudged past short fine
flat offbreak, defended to extra cover
short ball, cut away to sweeper-cover
stays on the crease to defend an offbreak
worked past midwicket for another single
hit back down the ground, Dilshan makes a diving collection to his left
worked past square leg for yet another single
pushed past point for a single
swept away from outside off
arm ball again, cramps Hussey on the cut shot, Hussey keeps it out
not much room again, hit straight to point
slower through the air, Hussey defends off the front foot
placed wide of cover-point, another single
nicely flighted, hit just to right of long-off, and they get a fumble out of Malinga by running hard
worked away against the turn, gets a single
flighted delivery, from wide of the crease, hit down to long-on for a single
offbreak, pushed between between point and cover-point
nicely worked away, wide of long-on, for an easy couple
pushes this wide of cover for a single
straighter one, Smith recovers and doesn't go too hard at the cut shot
full and fast, on the pads, deflected to short fine
much slower through the air, 86ks, drops and runs, cover swoops in but they are quick enough
cut away to the left of point, they take a single

nicely played! First boundary in 23.3 overs! Is looking for the big hit, but then changes his mind and goes for the late cut, places it fine of short third. Malinga gives the change, gets around it, then misfields. Lets it slip through his right hand
nudged to short fine
punched away to sweeper-cover for one

and Perera strikes almost immediately! He gas this knack of cutting the ball just enough. Lovely legcutter again. Short of a length, around off, making him play, then moving away enough to take the edge
full, slight swing, hit to mid-off
another legcutter, nearly played on. Johnson clearly didn't pick it early, the inside edge hits him on the pad. Hussey is alert, though, and he calls him through for the quick single
back of a length, pushed to point
goes down the ground this time, and retains the strike
not his best pull shot, hurries him up a bit, but he places it superbly between the two deep fielders on the leg side
that's his first boundary and also his fifty! A lovely short-arm pull too. Timed perfectly, placed even better, between deep square and deep midwicket. He deserves the big cheer he gets for the fifty
Kula learns his lesson, bowls fuller, gets a thick edge as Hussey drives, but it's all safe
another thick edge, from Johnson this time, but it is safe
another pull, along the ground this time, gets a single
full and straight, no room, defended by Johnson
back of a length, hit to long-off for a single
legcutter starts too straight, goes down the leg side, wily Sanga appeals but the umpire knows it is a wide
extra bounce, Johnson has to get the bottom hand off, and Hussey again is alert to calling him through for the single
short, into the pads, but pushed straight to midwicket
angled across him, and he is beaten on the cut shot
nips into the left-hander again, Hussey nurdles it for a single into the on side
clipped away off the pads, another single taken
quick, sharp offbreak, beats Johnson's poke
flighted, slightly slower, 86.8ks, and beats the outside edge with the offbreak again

dropped at first slip by Mahela. Johnson plays the reverse sweep that hardly goes anywhere, and Mahela dives to his left, gets there, but can't hold on to it. Good anticipation, but not executed perfectly
pushed wide of cover for one
quick delivery, no turn, played back to the bowler
angled into the pads, worked around the corner
yes, he bowls full and wide, but it's not quite the yorker, and he slices this half volley over point. Murali runs from third man to cut it off
yorker on off, they risk a single to mid-on, Silva's throw hits Johnson on the forearm
and Hussey flicks a length ball to the same man
slower ball, hit to the same man again
slower bouncer, Hussey keeps it down, takes a single to short fine
another slower bouncer, gets Johnson in the ribs area. They take a leg-bye. This is the second blow Johnson has taken in this over
nicely bowled, yorker outside off, Johnson doesn't get touch on it
bowled'im! Low full toss, nearly a yorker, Johnson plays across it, gets an inside edge onto the middle stump
spot on! Yorker, about three inches short of the crease. Can't do much with it
another yorker, this is even better, pitching on the crease. Digs it out, and that's the best he can do with it
misses the yorker, the low full toss is flicked away wide of deep midwicket
another yorker, gets it into the on side for a single. Superb over - three runs and a wicket
length ball wide of off, sliced over point for a couple
slower short ball again. Hastings nearly plays two shots to it. The second one is a guide towards third man. Lucky it doesn't carry
that's the quicker bouncer, 137ks, Hussey is clearly late on the hook
goes for the yorker, bowls a big wide down the leg side. Sanga does well
slower yorker, 122ks, gets just a single into the on side
lovely slower bouncer, 122.1ks, Hastings sways out of the line
Malinga is unlucky here. Another slower bouncer, gets the top edge but it sails over short fine. Three boundaries in the last 30.4 overs
yorker - full and wide - Hussey gets a single to cover
just mises the yorker length, Hastings gets a lot of power behind what is esentially a dig-out, but Kula sticks out his right hand and saves three runs
full and wide, with three men on the off-side boundary, concedes just a single
Hastings continues his charmed life. Late into the pull. The top-edge lands short of mid-off
full toss wide of off, Perera at sweeper-cover seems to have over-run it, but changes direction and dives to keep them to two
the first straight delivery to Hussey from Kula, but he can't beat midwicket
slower ball on the pads, Huss can get just a single
shot! Through extra cover. Makes room early, gets a length ball, gets room too, and he gets it past extra cover. The boundary, though, is very long there
slower bouncer, gets Hussey in the shoulder - he is too early into the pull, concedes just the leg-bye
that's the quicker bouncer, 134.1ks, Hastings gets the toe end on the pull, it bounces just in front of the bowler
slower yorker, 124.2ks, Hastings has no clue about it, it dips big time too. Even Sanga doesn't collect cleanly, and Hussey steals the bye
comes down the track, hits to deep midwicket, chances Perera's arm, and a combination of a dive and a wide throw gets them the couple
nice yorker, pitching around the crease, they take the single
low full toss, again bowled wide of Hussey,  and Tharanga lets it through his legs at extra cover

Michelle for Thisara! Hastings looks for the ramp shot, clearly not suited for that shot, doesn't get low, and Perera is full and straight and takes the prone middle stump. He is thrilled, raises his arms
another yorker, just outside off, Doherty digs and runs, but the throw from covers gets him in the forearm
nearly a yorker, Hussey hits it to long-off for a single

full toss, hit wide of long-on, they rush back for the second, Randiv's throw is loopy but direct, and there is a chance they could have taken the overthrow but Hussey ran too far after completing the second

inn2.comm: short, outside off, left alone, good carry, Haddin collects it about chest high
this time he goes to cut the short and wide delivery, but there is good bounce there, beating him for the height - bowled at 140.4ks
closer to the stumps. Tharanga plays the shortish ball with a vertical bat, towards point
slightly fuller, around off, Tharanga defends off the back foot
that's a beauty - and it did swing! At 146ks. Starting around off, leaving him, beating the outside edge
slightly shorter than the previous ball, Tharanga stays back and defends
gets shape away right away, Dilshan gets a thick edge past the slips
well bowled, 140ks, angling across him, Tharanga must have seen the first ball shape away from the right-hander, and plays for some in movement, which is not there. Beaten again
drops this into the covers and runs

nearly played on. Even Dilshan is expecting that swing he encountered first ball. Looking to crash this through the off side, and inside-edging a straight ball. The pad is behind the line, and saves him
back of a length angled across him, defended with an open face
tucked away off the pads for a single
nearly caught at third man! Throws his bat at this short and wide delivery, the thick edge nearly flies all the way to Siddle
well run, just drops it into the covers and rushes through. Good, positive calling
goes for the pull this time, but the ball is fuller than he expects and he just swings over the height of the ball
good pace, 147.8ks, Tharanga sways out of the line of this short one
angling into the pads, gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad
full and fast, 148.4ks, pushed to mid-off
Dilshan is into his act! This is gentle, short and wide, and he upper-cuts it over backward point. That's Dilshan's area, Siddle should know
full ball, hit powerfully down the ground, mid-off makes a diving save

Siddle comes back fast! Cramps him up on the short ball. Dilshan looks to pull it, but replays will tell him it is too full for the pull - pitched short of a length - and the tight line sort of cuffs him up. All he gets is a tame top edge that settles with Hussey, next to the square-leg umpire
length ball, slight shape into the left-hander, defended
wide half-volley, there to be hit, but Tharanga doesn't move his feet, and ends up swinging inside the line
left alone outside off
what a start for Sangakkara! Beautiful shot. He likes the pace, that the ball comes on, and just punches it square, off the back foot, and runs all four
stays on the crease, not much room this time, defends it back
length ball on the pads, clipped away square f fine leg for a couple, another good-looking shot
nearly played on, looking to defend, misjudges the line perhaps, gets an inside edge that misses the leg stump
another beautiful shot from Sangakkara, the G is enjoying these. This is somewhere between the punch and the cut, between point and cover-point. Lovely timing
tries the bouncer, pulled along the ground, to fine leg

Doherty you beauty! X-man with X-factor! This was another beautiful punch shot from Sangakkara. Doherty dives full length to his left at mid-off. Tharanga had backed up too far. Who would blame him? This seemed headed for the mid-off boundary. And Doherty, during the act of getting back up, flicks the throw direct too. He loves his work, absolutely thrilled
left alone outside off
square-driven, on the up, Sanga finds the cover fielder this time
length ball, shaping into the leg stump, pushed to mid-on
driven on the up again, finds mid-off

hat a beautiful shot! Lovely extra-cover drive. This is not the punch, but the extragvagant drive. Gets the length that allows him to do that, leans into it, the bat followthroughs till his back. On a knee too
angled across him, wide enough to leave alone
tucked away off the hip for a single
leg side this time, clipped away for a couple, slightly straight this is
cut away, wide of point, comes back for two by the time third man comes around
check-drive, but timed superbly, and placed smack between mid-off and mid-on, another couple
clipped off the pads, in front of square, another couple for Sanga - he is batting like a dream, everything has come smack off the middle of the bat
full ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
Classy again! Lovely extra-cover drive, helped by Doherty who lets it through his legs at extra cover. An over after pulling off a crazy run-out

Sanga, wearing Murali's jumper, is putting up an exhibition at the G. Spread the word around in Melbourne, fill the ground up. This is the off drive. Just meets the ball. And how well has he timed it? Between the bowler and mid-off. Four all the way
not the best of his hits, bounces over Siddle, through to mid-on
looks for the cover drive again, but gets an inside edge towards square leg - this angle might be working for Australia
leaves it alone outside off, a bit cautious after the last two balls
outswinger, starts wide of off, and keeps going wide

that's a lot of class in the middle right now. Short and wide all right, but Jayawardene had to reach for it, and he rolled his wrists on the cut shot to keep it down. And he placed it between point and third man
guides a length ball to third man for a single
Sanga can do no wrong, gets one short, widish, leans back, cuts - short-arm cut, no follow through - beats point, and then they run well too, taking three
against the run of play, Watson produces a superb outswinger, starting around off, making him play, and then leaving him, beating the outside edge
produces the edge there, but it is too thick and is wide of the first slip
beats him outside off, back of a length, moving away, Haddin shouts for it, but there is no edge
Sanga reaches for this widish delivery and drives, but can't beat extra cover
back of a length, around off, pushed to cover
slower ball, too short, guided past point for a single
bouncer, Mahela ducks under it
superb pull shot! Mahela picks the right one to pull. This bouncer is much gentler, and hardly rises waist high, and he connects sweetly. This bouncer certainly wasn't bowled as if he meant it
fuller now, around off, pushed to cover
driven straight of mid-off and they come through for one
the teasing delivery, thrown up wide of off, asking Mahela to drive. he resists - he knows he edged one last over and was beaten by another
slightly shorter, Mahela goes for the cut and is beaten by the bounce
shorter, wider, Mahela shapes for the upper-cut, but decides against it
too full, guided wide of mid-on for a single
back of a length, angling across him, defended back to the bowler
short and wide, cut away to third man for one
length ball, not much action on it, Sanga plays it back to him
shout for lbw, but clearly pitched outside leg. Surprising Hastings persisted with this shout for long
another similar shout, this time, though, he stifles the appeal
short and wide, and they have a deep point stationed for Sanga now
full, around off, Jayawardene is solid in defending
Watson has saved four! It was a sweet half-volley that Sanga had driven down the ground, but a desperate Watto dived to his left to get a hand to it
wide of off now, takes a single to sweeper-cover
length ball, around off, Mahela comes forward and drives it back to Watto
similar delivery, opens the face on the drive, but finds extra cover
slower ball, 122.9ks, Maehla shuffles across a bit in defending it back to Watson
flicked away from in front of the stumps for a single
just back of a length, around off, pushed to mid-off
worked into the leg side, from outside off, gets a single
check-drive, but mid-off is straight and attacking the ball
smack! That's a slap. Short ad wide, but Sanga goes back and pulls it between mid-on and midwicket. That's his response to the deep point
angled across him again, left alone this time
and leaves another wide delivery be
thick outside edge on this attempted straight drive - gets a single past extra cover
driven on the up, high elbow, but finds extra cover
square-driven, that finds the gap goes wide of deep point. Sanga comes back for two, helped by a fumble from Smith
off drive this time, but finds mid-off
dug in short, outside off, he dabs it down and takes a single
short, slanting down the leg side, pulled away without trouble, gets a single to fine leg
full, pushed to mid-on

Doherty strikes again after that crazy run-out! Mahela plays for the spin. This one doesn't. Caught dead in front. He is not pleased, he shouldn't be. The first ball hadn't turned either. He plays a forward defensive to this full delivery, and the ball goes with the arm, hitting him in front of middle
cuts the first ball away for a single
full ball, pushed down to long-on for a single
turn there, Silva defends it off the front foot
nearly another leg-before, the arm ball gets an inside edge towards fine leg
outside edge, along the ground, though, gets a single to third man
short, into the ribs, but he clips it towards square leg for a single
wide outside off, angling further, left alone
bouncer, wide down the leg side, easily ducks under it
on the pads, deflected towards fine leg
lovely leg glance, Sanga is on top of his game, waits for this to arrive on his pads, and then closes the bat face late, getting it delicately fine
driven to extra cover this time
flicked to midwicket, wants the single, Sanga rightly sends him back

Doherty is on fire here. Run-out, and then two wickets in two overs. And what a poor shot from Silva! Zero brains! Just dances down aimlessly and swings at a ball that is nowhere close to him. Watson back-pedals from mid-on and takes a safe catch. Will Sanga we left standing alone?

where were you hiding Xaveir Doherty? On a hat-trick in his second over. And this wicket could be the game. Sanga, who was batting so beautifully, looks for the paddle sweep, but this turns sharply from outside off, and kisses the leg stump. Done in by the break. Doherty is ecstatic, Sanga distraght
solid forward defensive from Perera
flat delivery, Perera stays back and defends
flights this a bit, Perera comes forward and defends
angled across him, hangs the bat there, but fails to edge it
full and straight, looking for the lbw, Mathews gets the bat down in time. Takes a single to midwicket
wide down the leg side

slight swing for Johnson. Bowled'im. More so pace than swing. Perera is backing away. Not wanting to get too close to its line. Misses the full and straight delivery, which holds its line a touch, and takes the off stump
pitched up outside off, Randiv pokes at it, is beaten
another play and miss, beaten by the angle
covers the line this time and guides this to third man for one
slower through the air, thick edge, along the ground
even slower, hanging in the air, turning away, beating the edge, 87.2ks
arm ball, 97ks, does well to keep it out
flat delivery, defended towards cover
tossed up around middle, forward defensive
turning away at 90ks, drawing him into a defensive poke, beating the outside edge
full ball, driven to extra cover
another full ball, driven to extra cover
hit uppishly towards long-off
flat and short, hit down the ground, and along it
nearly another wicket as Randiv is beaten on the cut shot
turn for Smith, played with it, to point
presses forward to defend a full delivery
nicely driven, stretching out to get close to it, and then driving it past extra cover
beats the outside edge, Randiv drives at a shortish delivery
straying down the leg side, called a wide
angled into the pads again, works it for a single
full ball, hit back to the bowler
another full and fast delivery, another forward defensive
another forward defensive, back to the bowler
pushed to extra cover
full toss, driven to long-off for one
nicely fielded off his own bowling, it was crisply hit to his left, but he dived and collected it cleanly, one-handed
angling into the pads, guided towards midwicket
lands this one well, just short of driving length, just outside off, Mathews stretches right forward to defend
that's a risky shot from in front of stumps, to a very full delivery, just gets the bat down in time
goes back in the crease, hits it wide of midwicket, and then Randiv puts in the dive to complete the second
short and wide, cut away in front of square
presses forward to defend this
stops at him, Randiv plays with hard hands, hits uppishly but wide of extra cover
full ball, defended, Smith fumbles in the covers to allow the single
full and flat, driven to mid-on
driven back to the bowler
slower through the air, played with the turn, past cover
cut away for a single
clipped away off the pads

nice shot, half-volley all right, but he has chipped it over extra cover. Hang on, though. There is drama. Run-out! Good work from Smith. Randiv is coming back for the third, the relay throw from Mitchell Starc (substitute) is a bit wide, Smith collects it one-handed and removes the bails in a flash, to beat Randiv's dive by a frame. I am sure that one-handed collection made this run-out possible
stretches forward and defends around his front pad
X-man has four! To go with that special run-out. Replay of Mahela dismissal. Stretching forward, defending for the turn, the ball goes straight on, would have missed both off and leg
flat, turning away, cut away to point
stump to stump, defended
forward defensive again
Shot! that's how tailenders should bat. No point hanging around now. Clears the front leg, and smashes this between the bowler and mid-on
... and starts off with a wide down the leg side
back of a length, punched to mid-off
back of a length, stays back to defend
another wide down the leg side
whipped away off the pads
nice shot, high elbow, driven on the up, helped by the fact that there is no mid-on, the area is vacant!
played wide of deep midwicket for a couple
short, tucks him up, defended
straight ball, Malinga doesn't play for spin, though, and keeps his pads away
flat-batted straight down the ground. Tennis forehand. Between bowler and mid-on
another forceful shot, straight to extra cover

dropped? Could that have been Michelle? Malinga slogged at it, and seemed to have got a bottom edge. Difficult chance but Haddin doesn't catch it. Not sure if there was an edge, but Haddin looked very disappointed
shot! Clear the leg, give arms space to move, and smack it over the bowler's head. Batting is easy at No. 10
that's nicely pulled, over square leg in the circle. They are having some fun here. Will it become serious? I doubt
dances down the track, swings, and misses
cool shot. Moves across a bit, lets the ball come, and closes the bat face on it, lofting it over short fine. Standing upright!
cramps him up with this one, defended back
left alone outside off
full and wide, squeezed out, flies across to third man, Hastings has to put in a dive to save four
well maybe not! Malinga is striking them clean! Opens up his stance, swings his arms at a shortish delivery, and clears mid-off by a long way
bouncer, and Malinga is beaten on the pull
backs away and guides a shortish delivery to third man - less than 100 required, by the way
bouncer, beats him on the pull
yorker, and Mathews keeps it out and takes a single to midwicket
cuts away a full toss! Poor delivery, and Malinga puts it away through covers. Malinga has moved onto his personal best. Australia rattled here?
thwack! Johnson bowls at a bouncer at 140ks, Mathews backs away and the pull shot sends it screaming to the deep midwicket boundary. And there is a man to deep there too. Clean connection
fuller, but not full enough to drive, Mathews defends it back
chips down the track, hits a shortish delivery wide of mid-on, and turns down a single
pulled to fine leg, and another single denied. Mathews is serious now. He thinks he is onto something
and dances down the track now and lofts Johnson over mid-on, comes back for two
and he retains strike now, just tips it into the covers and runs
take a single now, working it around the corner - 50 runs added between these two
overpitched delivery, Malinga drives it down to long-on
bunts a length ball into the covers, runs another single
tossed up, hanging in the air, inviting the big shot, Malinga obliges, gets the toe edge, but it goes wide of slip
the arm ball, Malinga keeps him pads out of the way, gets an inside edge, and runs two to just wide of fine leg
slower one now, Malinga takes the front pad out of the way and defends
back of a length, within the stumps, Mathews defends it back
slower bouncer, but way too high
slower ball again, hit back to the bowler
stays back of a length, around off, Mathews defends to cover
slower one, slips out of the hand, big wide outside off
regular pace, holds its line outside off, Mathews plays at it, and is beaten
comes down the track and hits to sweeper-cover for one
slower bouncer again, this one is not too high
angled down the leg side, and played with soft hands to make sure he can come back for two
full, driven down the ground, Clarke makes a diving save at straghtish midwicket
driven back to the bowler
takes a single to long-on

if you can hit the ball into the crowd at the MCG, that is going to be a six in any ground in the world. And what a sweet blow from Malinga. This is getting fun. He sees a full ball, clears a full ball, and clears his arms, lofting it about 15 rows behind long-on. The crowd has gone crazy
and forward defensive now, into the covers, and they steal a single too
beaten on the cut shot, more bounce than he expected
backs away looking to guide this to third man, beaten by the pace, rapid delivery
slower ball, and succeeds in running this down to third man
played with an open face, towards point
bouncer, too high, Australia need to get their act together

Malinga needs to calm down a bit. Mathews hits it straight to mid-off, says no right away, but Malinga keeps running, then turns like a truck, and then plonks his bat back. A direct ht from Starc would have got him here
pulled wide of long-on, two more, this is getting more and more interesting
low full toss, and he paddles it for one
immaculate forward-defensive from Mathews

craziness all around. Mathews shapes up to reverse-sweep, Doherty fires it down the leg side. It is way way down the leg side. Haddin has no chance of collecting it. Umpire calls it byes. Because of the reverse-sweep?
this is surely wide down the leg side, and given, because he has not tried the reverse?
turn and bounce, and beats Mathews on the cut
flat delivery, pushed to mid-on
gets well forward and dead-bats this
Ma-linga! Ma-linga! Ma-linga! Backs away, gives him all three stumps to aim at, and lofts this length ball for a straight six. Over his head. What a blow
beaten on the cut shot here, backing away as he plays the shot
slower bouncer, sways out of its way
routine bouncer, doesn't even get high up, Malinga is happy to take a blow on the shoulder
pushes this full ball to mid-off and takes the single
pulls this away, keeps it down, gets a single

Angelooooooo! What a shot! Beautiful. Dances down the track as if to a spinner, and drives it over mid-off. Classical. High elbow. Lovely follow through - 44 required. It's fifty too for Mathews. The crowd is going wild
defends this back-of-a-length delivery
four more! Pull from head high! Keeps it down perfectly. Through midwicket. Game. is. On
chips down the track and defends this length ball to cover
slower short one, swivel-pulls it, gets a single to fine leg
backs away and cuts, misses
pulls, mistimes, ends up hitting it over the bowler's head, gets a single
full, middle and leg, Malinga is not showing him his pads, dead-bats it
Yorker. Kept out. Backing away, he gets the bat down in time
slower ball, Malinga swings, and mis-hits, and it still lands safe, wide of long-off. Starc can't make it. Strike off two more. 36 required now
full ball, makes room, defends it back to the bowler
slower ball, agricultured from way outside off, past midwicket, everything is going into vacant spaces
back of a length, around off, defended
wide down the leg side, aiming for ribs, getting it wrong
defended, solidly smack off the middle of the bat. The ball has done nothing for the last 15 overs. Not one ball has moved off the straight - except for Doherty's offbreaks
punched to cover, finds the fielder
whoa! what a stunning pull shot! Not a very impressive short ball, but he rocks back and sends it screaming over midwicket. Predictable?
comes down the track and slashes this into the off side, gets a single
backs away and misses a straight delivery. Nothing going Australia's way
immediately he gets one to hold its line, around off, but Angelo's bat is broad as usual
short and wide, runs it down to third man for one
nips away, Malinga backs away and pokes at a shortish delivery. Flood light between bat and ball, though
fuller, length ball, straightening outside off, Malinga plays for the angle and is beaten
smashed away. Malinga throws the wind to the caution, and throws his bat at a full one, past extra cover it goes. Hussey - from long-off - makes a diving save. Will these two saved be crucial?

it's flying to the fine-leg boundary, but thankfully the umpire is alert and calls it a dead ball. Malinga didn't do anything to this short ball, just let it hit him, and it deflected off towards the boundary. Clearly he didn't play a shot
wide, full and way too wide...nerves? The ch-word?
inches from getting out. Doherty nearly pulls off another screamer. Hit loopily wide of extra cover. Doherty takes two steps, then dives full length, but it evades him
refuses the single off Johnson. Shades of Laxman there?
slower ball, around off, Mathews defends off the front foot

Angelooooo! whaddaplayaaaaa! Beautiful shot. Classical inside-out shot upon having charged down the wicket. Except it is against Johnson bowling at 140kmph. What a clean strike, over long-off. Only 16 required
and suddenly he slogs, but it goes along the ground to short midwicket
to square leg, easily done, not sure if Malinga on strike gives them that much greater a chance for a wicket
length ball, pushed down to long-off for one. Mathews doesn't mind exposing Malinga to Watson
angled into the pads, worked around the corner comfortably, scrambles back for two. Fifty for Malinga! I dare anybody to wipe that smile off his face in this moment. Sri Lanka flags all around
left alone also now

What. A. Strike. Nerves? What nerves? He is striking it as if playing in a neighbourhood game in Rathgama. Makes room, lofts this length ball over Watson's head. One bounce for four. Less than 10 required now
full, stays back, places it wide of mid-on

shot! Angelo is finishing this off. Hit over wide mid-on. Length ball, gets to front foot and clears the ring easily. Highest ninth-wicket partnership. Ever. Beating Kapil and Kirmani's 126 from WC 1983, when Kapil scored 175
tosses this up, teases, Malinga slogs, gets an inside edge, and a single
scores are level, coolly he has forced this shortish delivery past point. Melbourne is like Colombo today. There is blue all ever at the G
flat-batted to mid-on, they think of one, don't take it

twist n the tail? Smith legendarily missed one run-out a few weeks ago, in Mohali, giving away four overthrows. This time, though, he hits the stumps direct, and catches Malinga short of a suicidal run. It was hit straight to him at cover. And they stopped and started too
forward defensive. Doubts in SL minds now
Goes for the big shot, gets an inside edge towards short fine. They decide against the single. Murali will have to face
defended to point. Mathews has the stakes on. Murali keeps his head and sends him back. There was no way there was a run here

Murali has done it! Malinga is ecstatic. Runs onto the field. Not a great delivery. Sliding down the leg side, and Murali flicks it fine of short fine. Murali exults too. Mathews is cool. He was cool throughout
